item.title: Adding doors need help!
item.dc:creator: @eballer48 eballer48
item.description:
@eballer48 wrote:

[quote=“stooks, post:3, topic:413985”]Quote from: stooks on Today at 07:41:20 PM
Self explanatory how would i add a door, then be able to click on it and it brings you to the other side -.-

PI?

If so go to objectmanager.java

SRC > Server> World

Scroll down you should see a code like this,

Code: [Select]c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(4458, 3014, 5241, 0, 10);
Fill in the info:

Code: [Select]c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(OBJECTID, XCord, YCord, Height, Rotation);
add these with the others if you need to find obj ids look here:

Such as… c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1601, 1909, 4644, 1, 10); //dungeoneering doors c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1601, 1908, 4647, 1, 10); //dungeoneering doors c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1601, 1900, 4650, 1, 10); //dungeoneering doors c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1601, 1894, 4651, 1, 10); //dungeoneering doors c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1601, 1898, 4646, 1, 10); //dungeoneering doors c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1601, 1898, 4632, 1, 10); //dungeoneering doors c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1601, 1902, 4628, 1, 10); //dungeoneering doors c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1601, 1909, 4631, 1, 10); //dungeoneering doors c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1601, 1909, 4634, 1, 10); //dungeoneering doors c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1601, 1894, 4628, 1, 10); //dungeoneering doors[/quote]

Is it spaced correctly with the TAB button and have you compiled? -.-"
cus i’ve already tried that -.-

Read full topic

item.title: Adding doors need help!
item.dc:creator: @stooks stooks
item.description:
@stooks wrote:

Quote from: stooks on Today at 07:41:20 PM
Self explanatory how would i add a door, then be able to click on it and it brings you to the other side -.-

PI?

If so go to objectmanager.java

SRC > Server> World

Scroll down you should see a code like this,

Code: [Select]c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(4458, 3014, 5241, 0, 10);
Fill in the info:

Code: [Select]c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(OBJECTID, XCord, YCord, Height, Rotation);
add these with the others if you need to find obj ids look here:

Such as… c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1601, 1909, 4644, 1, 10); //dungeoneering doors c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1601, 1908, 4647, 1, 10); //dungeoneering doors c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1601, 1900, 4650, 1, 10); //dungeoneering doors c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1601, 1894, 4651, 1, 10); //dungeoneering doors c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1601, 1898, 4646, 1, 10); //dungeoneering doors c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1601, 1898, 4632, 1, 10); //dungeoneering doors c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1601, 1902, 4628, 1, 10); //dungeoneering doors c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1601, 1909, 4631, 1, 10); //dungeoneering doors c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1601, 1909, 4634, 1, 10); //dungeoneering doors c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(1601, 1894, 4628, 1, 10); //dungeoneering doors
cus i’ve already tried that -.-

item.title: Adding doors need help!
item.dc:creator: @eballer48 eballer48
item.description:
@eballer48 wrote:

stooks:

Self explanatory how would i add a door, then be able to click on it and it brings you to the other side -.-

PI?

If so go to objectmanager.java

SRC > Server> World

Scroll down you should see a code like this,

Fill in the info:

add these with the others if you need to find obj ids look here:

http://rspscodes.synthasite.com/object-codes.php

Now to make it open?

Go into actionhandler.java

Src > Server > Model > Players

Search

Should see something like this:

//doors case 6749: if(obX == 3562 && obY == 9678) { c.getPA().object(3562, 9678, 6749, -3, 0); c.getPA().object(3562, 9677, 6730, -1, 0); } else if(obX == 3558 && obY == 9677) { c.getPA().object(3558, 9677, 6749, -1, 0); c.getPA().object(3558, 9678, 6730, -3, 0); } break; case 6730: if(obX == 3558 && obY == 9677) { c.getPA().object(3562, 9678, 6749, -3, 0); c.getPA().object(3562, 9677, 6730, -1, 0); } else if(obX == 3558 && obY == 9678) { c.getPA().object(3558, 9677, 6749, -1, 0); c.getPA().object(3558, 9678, 6730, -3, 0); } break;

Now add this:

//doors case OBJECTID: if(obX == #### && obY == ####) { c.getPA().object(OBJID, X, Y, -3, 0); c.sendMessage("You open the door."); } break;

make sure spacing is lined up use ‘TAB’ key and make sure all the info matches what you put in objectmanager.

Lastly if you dont want the door to open you just want it to move you replace

with

Need more help? PM me.

Read full topic
